20.title: Cancer Control P.L.A.N.E.T.
20.text: Cancer Control P.L.A.N.E.T. is a web portal that links to comprehensive cancer control resources for public health professionals. It is a U.S. Government site sponsored by the National Cancer Institute, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the American Cancer Society, the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA), the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ), and the Commission on Cancer.

295.title: The Community Guide: Nutrition
295.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force recommends several community-based interventions to promote a healthy diet.

296.title: The Community Guide: Physical Activity
296.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force recommends several community-based interventions to promote physical activity.

297.title: Dietary Guidelines for Americans 2015--2020
297.text: The 2015--2020 Dietary Guidelines is designed to help Americans eat a healthier diet. Intended for policymakers and health professionals, this edition of the Dietary Guidelines outlines how people can improve their overall eating patterns -- the complete combination of foods and drinks in their diet.

298.title: Physical Activity Guidelines for Americans
298.text: The Physical Activity Guidelines for Americans provides evidence-based guidance to help Americans maintain or improve their health through physical activity.

299.title: Tools & Resources for the 2015--2020 Dietary Guidelines
299.text: Use these tools and resources to learn more about the 2015--2020 Dietary Guidelines -- and share key messages with patients, clients, professionals, and other audiences.

300.title: Move Your Way Campaign
300.text: Move Your Way is the promotional campaign for the second edition of the Physical Activity Guidelines for Americans. Our goal is to help people live healthier lives through increased physical activity.

218.title: Let's Talk About It: Medicines to Help Prevent Breast Cancer
218.text: To support implementation of the recommendation on Medicines to Help Prevent Breast Cancer, the Task Force created a companion guide to facilitate meaningful discussions between healthcare providers and their patients. A two-page document, the first page outlines basic information about risk factors for breast cancer, the potential benefits and harms of risk-reducing medicines, and questions for patients to ask their healthcare providers. The second page provides additional information on assessing patient risk and more detailed data on benefits and harms.

287.title: The Surgeon General's Call to Action to Control Hypertension
287.text:
The Surgeon General's Call to Action to Control Hypertension seeks to avert
the negative health effects of hypertension across the U.S. by identifying interventions that can be
implemented, adapted, and expanded across diverse settings.

288.title: Hypertension Resources for Health Professionals (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)
288.text: Resources for health professionals to support hypertension prevention and management and educate others.

289.title: The Community Guide: Cardiovascular Disease
289.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force has several resources related to community-focused interventions for blood pressure monitoring, management, and control.

290.title: Million Hearts Initiative
290.text: Million HeartsÂ® 2022 is a national initiative to prevent 1 million heart attacks and strokes within 5 years.

268.title: The Community Guide: Findings for Obesity
268.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force recommends multicomponent interventions that use technology-supported coaching or counseling to help nonpregnant adults lose weight and maintain weight loss.

269.title: The Community Guide: Pregnancy Health
269.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force recommends exercise programs during pregnancy to reduce the development of gestational hypertension.

260.title: Interventions for Tobacco Smoking Cessation in Adults, Including Pregnant Persons: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
260.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

278.title: Screening for Lung Cancer: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
278.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

291.title: Screening for Hypertension in Adults: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
291.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

311.title: National Diabetes Prevention Program
311.text: The National Diabetes Prevention Program (National DPP) is a partnership of public and private organizations working to prevent or delay type 2 diabetes. Partners make it easier for people at risk for type 2 diabetes to participate in evidence-based lifestyle change programs to reduce their risk of type 2 diabetes.

312.title: Diabetes for Health Professionals (National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases)
312.text: NIDDK clinical practice tools and patient education materials can help health care professionals effectively meet the needs of people with or at risk for diabetes.

313.title: The Community Guide: Diabetes
313.text: Combined diet and physical activity promotion programs to prevent type 2 diabetes among people at increased risk, from the Community Preventive Services Task Force.

344.title: Sexually Transmitted Diseases (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)
344.text: The CDC provides information about STIs, including chlamydia and gonorrhea.

345.title: Recommendations for Providing Quality STD Clinical Services, 2020
345.text: This report provides CDC recommendations to U.S. health care providers regarding quality clinical services for sexually transmitted diseases (STDs) for primary care and STD specialty care settings.

346.title: Sexually Transmitted Infections: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine Report
346.text: The CDC commissioned the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine to convene a committee to examine the prevention and control of sexually transmitted infections in the United States and provide recommendations for action.

347.title: The Community Guide: HIV, STIs, and Teen Pregnancy
347.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force has issued several recommendations on the prevention of HIV/AIDS, other STIs, and teen pregnancy.

348.title: Canadian Guidelines on Sexually Transmitted Infections
348.text: Public Health Agency of Canada guidelines on STIs.

340.title: Screening for Colorectal Cancer: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice (2021)
340.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

301.title: Healthy Lifestyle for CVD Prevention in Adults with Cardiovascular Risk Factors: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
301.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

375.title: The Community Guide: Dental Caries (Cavities): Community Water Fluoridation
375.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force (CPSTF) recommends community water fluoridation to reduce tooth decay (i.e., dental caries or cavities).

376.title: The Community Guide: School-Based Dental Sealant Delivery Programs to Prevent Caries
376.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force (CPSTF) recommends school-based programs to deliver dental sealants and prevent dental caries (tooth decay) among children.

377.title: "My Water's Fluoride"
377.text: A CDC tool that may assist in determining local water system fluoridation status.

378.title: Early Childhood Health (Health Resources and Services Administration)
378.text: The Health Resources and Services Administration's  website contains various oral health program resources, including the "Bright Futures: Oral Health--Pocket Guide, 3rd edition," an overview of oral health prevention and interventions.

368.title: Prevent Heart Disease (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)
368.text: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention provides information on the prevention of heart disease.

396.title: Atrial Fibrillation (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)
396.text: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention provides information about atrial fibrillation.

317.title: Screening for Vitamin D Deficiency in Adults: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
317.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

353.title: Screening for Gestational Diabetes: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
353.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

314.title: Screening for Prediabetes and Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
314.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

270.title: Behavioral Counseling Interventions for Healthy Weight and Weight Gain in Pregnancy: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
270.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

379.title: Screening and Interventions to Prevent Dental Caries in Children Younger Than Five Years: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
379.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

369.title: Coronary Heart Disease (National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute)
369.text: Patient resources related to coronary heart disease provided by the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute.

370.title: Let's Talk About It: Starting Aspirin to Prevent Heart Disease and Stroke A Discussion Guide for Healthcare Professionals and Patients
370.text: To support implementation of the recommendation on Aspirin to Prevent Cardiovascular Disease (CVD), the Task Force created a companion guide to facilitate meaningful discussions between healthcare professionals and their patients. Healthcare professionals are encouraged to use this guide as a conversation starter with their patients. This guide is not intended to serve as a risk assessment tool or decision aid.

425.title: COPD National Action Plan (NHLBI and CDC)
425.text: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the National Institutes of Health, and other federal agencies provide a comprehensive systems-based COPD National Action Plan to reduce the burden of COPD.

426.title: Tobacco Reports And Publications (U.S. Surgeon General)
426.text: The U.S. Surgeon General provides tools to prevent tobacco use and promote smoking cessation.

388.title: Health Equity Resource Toolkit for State Practitioners Addressing Obesity Disparities
388.text:
This document was created to provide examples of strategies and surveillance data which can
be used to inform obesity prevention initiatives.

389.title: Health Literacy Universal Precautions Toolkit
389.text: The Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality Health Literacy Universal Precautions Toolkit contains general guidance to assist primary care settings with linking patients to nonmedical support.

397.title: Screening for Atrial Fibrillation: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
397.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

349.title: Screening for Chlamydia and Gonorrhea: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
349.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

433.title: Cholesterol Resources for Health Professionals (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention)
433.text: Health professionals have many opportunities to educate others. To support that effort, CDC's Division for Heart Disease and Stroke Prevention has put together two sets of educational materials. One set is for patients, and another set is for professionals.

442.title: Sexually Transmitted Infections: Adopting a Sexual Health Paradigm
442.text: The National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine (NASEM) provides a comprehensive systems-based approach for prevention and control of sexually transmitted infections.

401.title: The Community Guide: Targeted School-Based Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Programs to Reduce Depression and Anxiety Symptoms
401.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force (CPSTF) recommends targeted school-based cognitive behavioral therapy programs to reduce depression and anxiety symptoms among school-aged children and adolescents who are assessed to be at increased risk for these conditions.

402.title: The Community Guide: Individual Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy to Reduce Psychological Harm for Traumatic Events Among Children and Adolescents
402.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force (CPSTF) recommends individual cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) for symptomatic youth who have been exposed to traumatic events based on strong evidence of effectiveness in reducing psychological harm.

403.title: The Community Guide: Group Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy to Reduce Psychological Harm for Traumatic Events Among Children and Adolescents
403.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force (CPSTF) recommends group cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) for symptomatic youth who have been exposed to traumatic events based on strong evidence of effectiveness in reducing psychological harm.

404.title: Anxiety and Depression in Children (CDC)
404.text: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention provides information on anxiety in childhood.

405.title: The Community Guide: Collaborative Care for the Management of Depressive Disorders
405.text:
The Community Preventive Services Task Force (CPSTF) recommends collaborative care for the management of depressive disorders based on strong evidence of effectiveness in improving depression symptoms, adherence to treatment, response to treatment, and remission and recovery from depression.

The CPSTF also finds that collaborative care models provide good economic value based on the weight of evidence from studies that assessed both costs and benefits.

406.title: Playbook: Develop a Shared Care Plan (AHRQ)
406.text: A shared care plan is a patient-centered health record designed to facilitate communication among members of the care team, including the patient and providers. Rather than relying on separate medical and behavioral health care (treatment) plans, a shared plan of care combines both aspects to encourage a team approach to care.

407.title: The Collaborative Care Model (CMS)
407.text: The collaborative care model offers one approach to integration in which primary care providers, care managers, and psychiatric consultants work together to provide care and monitor patients' progress. Programs using this model have achieved improved clinical outcomes and reduced costs for a variety of mental health conditions, in a variety of settings, using several different payment mechanisms. This brief highlights the collaborative care model as a potential option for implementing integrated care under the Medicaid health homes authority described in Section 2703 of the Affordable Care Act.

408.title: The Surgeon General's Call to Action to Implement the National Strategy for Suicide Prevention
408.text: The Surgeon General's Call to Action seeks to advance progress toward full implementation of the National Strategy for Suicide Prevention. The Call to Action emphasizes that the 13 goals and 60 objectives of the National Strategy remain as relevant today as they were when the strategy was last updated, and that these goals and objectives need to be fully implemented to make a difference in reducing suicide rates.

409.title: Suicide Prevention Resource Center
409.text: The Suicide Prevention Resource Center, supported by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, offers various resources on suicide prevention.

357.title: Vitamin, Mineral, and Multivitamin Supplementation to Prevent Cardiovascular Disease and Cancer: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
357.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

390.title: Behavioral Counseling Interventions to Promote a Healthy Diet and Physical Activity for CVD Prevention in Adults Without CVD Risk Factors: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
390.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

371.title: Aspirin Use to Prevent Cardiovascular Disease: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
371.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

502.title: How You Can Prevent Sexually Transmitted Diseases (CDC)
502.text: The CDC provides information about behavioral counseling and other STI prevention strategies.

503.title: Sexually Transmitted Infections: Summary of CDC Treatment Guidelines--2021
503.text: A brief booklet summarizing treatment recommendations found in CDC's 2021 STI Treatment Guidelines.

504.title: Genital Herpes (CDC)
504.text: Treatment guidelines for genital herpes from the CDC.

505.title: A Guide to Taking a Sexual History (CDC)
505.text: This guide offers a framework for discussing sexual health issues to help complete the overall picture of a patient's health.

449.title: The Community Guide: Skin Cancer
449.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force recommends interventions for skin cancer prevention in child care centers; primary and middle schools; outdoor occupational, recreational, and tourism settings; and communities.

450.title: Melanoma Dashboard (CDC)
450.text: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's Melanoma Dashboard provides state and local data for melanoma incidence and mortality, UV radiation levels, and other risk factors.

463.title: TB Centers of Excellence for Training, Education, and Medical Consultation
463.text: The CDC offers expert medical consultation to US clinicians with questions about patients being evaluated for tuberculosis or latent tuberculosis infection.

464.title: Tuberculosis: CDC Tools for Health Care Providers
464.text: The CDC maintains several resources and continuing education activities on latent tuberculosis infection for clinicians.

465.title: Latent Tuberculosis Infection: A Guide for Primary Health Care Providers
465.text: A CDC guide for primary health care clinicians on latent tuberculosis infection.

466.title: CDC Latent Tuberculosis Infection Resources
466.text: An online resource hub for information about latent tuberculosis infection from the CDC.

467.title: Think. Test. Treat TB
467.text: An online resource hub for information about latent tuberculosis from the CDC.

468.title: Resources for TB Screening and Testing of Health Care Personnel
468.text: Resources for tuberculosis screening of health care personnel from the CDC.

469.title: Estimated Tuberculosis Burden by Country, World Health Organization
469.text: Information on estimated tuberculosis burden by country is available from the World Health Organization.

470.title: Global Tuberculosis Report 2022, World Health Organization
470.text: Annual global tuberculosis report from the World Health Organization.

471.title: Guidelines for the Prevention and Treatment of Opportunistic Infections in Adults and Adolescents With HIV
471.text: Guidelines for the prevention and treatment of opportunistic infections in adults and adolescents with HIV are available through HIV.gov.

416.title: SAMHSA Evidence-Based Practices Resource Center
416.text: The Evidence-Based Practices Resource Center provides communities, clinicians, policy-makers and others with the information and tools to incorporate evidence-based practices into their communities or clinical settings.

573.title: The Community Guide: Mental Health Benefits Legislation
573.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force recommends mental health benefits legislation to increase appropriate utilization of mental health services for persons with mental health conditions.

574.title: Anxiety Disorders
574.text: The National Institute of Mental Health provides information on anxiety disorders.

488.title: Expert Panel on Integrated Guidelines for Cardiovascular Health and Risk Reduction in Children and Adolescents
488.text: The National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute's Expert Panel on Integrated Guidelines for Cardiovascular Health and Risk Reduction in Children and Adolescents developed comprehensive, evidence-based guidelines addressing the known risk factors for cardiovascular disease to assist all primary care professionals in both the promotion of cardiovascular health and the identification and management of specific risk factors from infancy into young adult life.

489.title: The Community Guide
489.text: Recommendations from the Community Preventive Services Task Force.

509.title: The Community Guide: Community-Wide Campaigns to Promote the Use of Folic Acid Supplements
509.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force recommends community-wide education campaigns to promote the use of folic acid supplements among persons of childbearing age.

525.title: Let's Talk About It: Preventing HIV with PrEP
525.text: This guide is a companion to the Task Force recommendation on Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) to Prevent Acquisition of HIV . This guide is for people who do not have HIV. The first page of the guide is intended for patients. It outlines basic information about the benefits and harms of taking PrEP and lists important questions for patients to ask their healthcare professionals about this preventive medication. The second page provides additional information about the recommendation, including information geared toward healthcare professionals about who should take this medication, approved PrEP formulations, and follow-up care.

526.title: Preexposure Prophylaxis for the Prevention of HIV Infection in The United States - 2021 Update
526.text: The CDC provides guidelines on PrEP for the prevention of HIV.

527.title: Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP)
527.text: The CDC provides additional resources on PrEP for both clinicians and consumers.

528.title: Complete List of PrEP Best Practices
528.text: The CDC has compiled a list of PrEP interventions and best practices.

529.title: NCHHSTP AtlasPlus
529.text: County- and state-level HIV prevalence data for the United States.

497.title: The Community Guide: Exercise Programs to Prevent Gestational Hypertension
497.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force recommends exercise programs for pregnant women to reduce the development of gestational hypertension.

476.title: Oral Health Fact Sheet (HRSA)
476.text: A fact sheet from the Health Resources & Services Administration.

477.title: Integration of Oral Health and Primary Care Practice (HRSA)
477.text: HRSA Report emphasizing optimal collaborations between primary care clinicians and oral health professionals.

478.title: Oral Health in America: A Report of the Surgeon General
478.text: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services report from the Surgeon General.

479.title: Oral Health in America: Advances and Challenges (NIH)
479.text: Report that comprehensively describe the importance of oral health to overall health and highlight advances and challenges toward improving oral health in the US.

530.title: Preexposure Prophylaxis to Prevent Acquisition of HIV: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
530.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

459.title: Hormone Therapy for the Primary Prevention of Chronic Conditions in Postmenopausal People: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
459.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

542.title: Preventing Child Abuse and Neglect: A Technical Package for Policy, Norm, and Programmatic Activities
542.text: This Centers for Disease Control and Prevention report offers a group of strategies based on best available evidence to assist in prevention of child abuse and neglect.

543.title: Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs) Prevention Resource for Action: A Compilation of the Best Available Evidence
543.text: This Centers for Disease Control and Prevention report presents the best evidence to prevent adverse childhood experiences.

544.title: Child Maltreatment Prevention Resource Guide
544.text: The US Department of Health and Human Services developed a "Prevention Resource Guide" to support and promote family well-being and prevention of child maltreatment.

545.title: Child Welfare Information Gateway
545.text: The US Department of Health and Human Services offers publications and additional resources on child welfare that could be helpful to primary care clinicians.

480.title: Screening and Preventive Interventions for Oral Health in Children, Adolescents, and Adults: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
480.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

454.title: Breast Cancer: Information for Professionals
454.text: The National Cancer Institute has information on breast cancer screening for health care professionals.

455.title: Let's Talk About It: Screening for Breast Cancer
455.text: This guide is a companion to the Task Force recommendation on Screening for Breast Cancer. The purpose of the guide is to help healthcare professionals explain the Task Force recommendation and begin to engage female patients ages 40-74 in a discussion about screening for breast cancer. It contains basic information on what patients need to know, including who should be screened, health disparities and inequities, and questions that patients may have.

456.title: Q&A with Journal of the American Academy of PAs
456.text: Q&A with the Journal of the American Academy of PAs.

575.title: Screening for Anxiety Disorders in Adults: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
575.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

566.title: CDC Guides on Fall Prevention Interventions
566.text: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has guides on fall prevention interventions.

567.title: STEADI (Stopping Elderly Accidents, Death, and Injuries)
567.text: The CDC STEADI (Stopping Elderly Accidents, Death, and Injuries) initiative helps reduce fall risk among older patients.

568.title: Falls and Falls Prevention (NIH)
568.text: The National Institutes of Health provides information on falls and fall prevention.

537.title: The Community Guide: CPSTF Findings for Obesity
537.text: The Community Preventive Services Task Force recommends several youth interventions promoting physical activity and healthy eating, access to affordable healthy food and beverages, healthy food and beverage choices, and fostering physical activity among children, reducing sedentary screen time, and using digital health interventions for weight management.

538.title: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: Obesity
538.text: The CDC has resources available for families and clinicians addressing high BMI.

410.title: Screening for Anxiety, Depression, and Suicide Risk in Children and Adolescents: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
410.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

561.title: Perinatal Quality Collaboratives (CDC)
561.text: Perinatal Quality Collaboratives work at the state level to improve the quality of care for mothers and babies.

562.title: California Maternal Quality Care Collaborative Toolkit
562.text: California Maternal Quality Care Collaborative toolkit on improving the health care response to obstetric hemorrhage.

563.title: Iron Fact Sheet for Clinicians
563.text: The National Institutes of Health's Office of Dietary Supplements provides a fact sheet on iron for clinicians.

490.title: Screening for Lipid Disorders in Children and Adolescents: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
490.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.

427.title: Screening for Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease: AFP's Putting Prevention Into Practice
427.text: The journal American Family Physician (AFP) provides a series of short case studies and quizzes based on recommendations issued by the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force.
